thread.title: Another dual-threat QB gets Georgia offer
thread.title_full: Another dual-threat QB gets Georgia offer

title: Another dual-threat QB gets Georgia offer
text:
Another dual-threat QB gets Georgia offer Georgia continues it's pursuit of a dual-threat quarterback, as another reports an offer from the Bulldogs. Slot to Georgia Links 
Georgia needs to add two quarterbacks in the 2018 class and the Bulldogs are searching far and wide to fill that need. Jalen Mayden (Sachse; Sachse, Tex.) tweeted Thursday evening that he has received an offer from UGA making it five dual-threat signal callers who have been tendered by the Bulldogs. 
The offer from UGA gives Mayden 18 thus far with Houston, Louisville, and Mississippi State considered as the favorites. At 6-foot-2, 210 pounds, Mayden also has offers from Baylor, Ohio State, Nebraska, and Tennessee among others. Not a member? For a limited time, buy one month of Dawgs247 VIP, get two months FREE! 
In 2016 the four-star signal caller completed 198 of 285 passes for 2,840 yards 27 touchdowns and four interceptions. He also rushed 131 times for 632 yards and 11 touchdowns. 
Currently Mayden is ranked as the 213th overall prospect and as the ninth dual-threat quarterback in the nation according to the industry-generated 247Sports Composite. He's also seen as the 30th overall prospect in Texas. 
(What's next for the Bulldogs? Make sure you're in the loop -- take a few moments to sign up for our FREE Bulldogs Newsletter! ) Author
